subject: Home Alone
event:
Parris is off in Kansas City, having fun at ConQuest.  I'm here at home, working, working, working.  It's not fair, it isn't.  Waaaah.

I am getting a lot done.  Finished an Arya chapter yesterday, and a Sansa chapter the day before.  (And before you guys assume I'm writing a chapter a day, I said "finished," not "wrote."  Large portions of these particular chapters were written years ago.  A chapter a day?  I wish).  Felt good to get them done.  Been making a lot of progress with Dany too.

Even so, the time is going by so fast.  I grow ever more pessimistic, but I can't think about dates and deadlines now.  My mantra remains the same.  One chapter at a time, one page at a time, one sentence at a time.

props.current_music: The Only Living Boy in New York

comments.article: Progress is progress - too bad deadlines can't be damned...
...one fan at a time. :)

*grins*
he'd take forever to finish ^^
I will patiently wait for the story to be told. Take your time, and get it done right. :)

I'm probably one of the few folks reading your blog who doesn't mind that the last period hasn't been set in place in the final book yet-- I'm still in Storm of Swords. ;)

I've got to say that it's pretty exciting thinking ahead to where everyone will go over the next books/years. And Arya and Dany are two of my favorite characters so it's fun to hear you've just finished more chapters with them, that there's still so much more left I get to enjoy for the first time about them. :D

One chapter at a time, one page at a time, one sentence at a time.

Yep, and before you know it, it's football time again!
we are waiting for the progress here, in Russia, and wish you good luck and good writing! of course, you are not alone :)!

comments.upictitle: J3n the Destruct0r: OH HAI I LIEK ABORTIONS
comments.article: It's all good, most of us are patient:)

Arya and Sansa?! Squee!

Aaaand with GRRM's good example before me, I'm going to stop reading about Westeros and work on my BA so's I can graduate. One page at a time, one sentence at a time...

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: howler monkey
comments.article: Glad to hear that the writing is going well, George. A pity you couldn't make ConQuest, but then, neither could I. Damn these "jobs." You could always pretend you're at a con by eating cheetos, drinking unidentifiable "punch" and getting into an argument with yourself over who was the best Green Lantern. Not that *I've* ever done that....yeeeaaaah.

comments.upictitle: alive isn't sad // it is when it's over: [ASOIAF] Sansa faceless.
comments.article: A good story takes time to tell. Take it!
Keep fighin' the good fight, George.  Or, the painfully realistic fight where no one is safe from the chopping block.  One of those. :)

As the late great Douglas Adams once said
"I love deadlines. I especially
like the whooshing sound they
make as they go flying by."

Keep fighting the fight, George!

And Sansa's in ADWD? Interesting...

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: boom headshot
comments.article:
don't jinx it, wert, goddammit.
<--- unrepentant Sansa fangirl
If that Sansa chapter is indeed for ADWD, this makes my day!

Once it whittles down to "one word at a time", you know it's time to plan more updates about your updates. ;)


-a random writer who shook your hand at the last WFC
and it will be good when the pages finally hit my eager fingers!  We are all supporting your efforts! Keep up the good work!!!
comments.subject: When it comes it comes

comments.article: All your fans appreciate your hard work! Hang in there, George.
Thanks for doing this for all us!

Glad to hear it's coming along. I'm debating if i want to read the first 4 books again before you're done with ADOD.

*sigh* decisions decisions.

I always usually go back and re-read a series when the next one comes out... especially when it's years in between, keeps it fresh.

And this series is definitely one worth re-reading. Of course it also supports the writers since I'll usually loan a book to someone or one of my dog ends up destroying it or some such disaster will befall one of the books and it needs to be replaced.
I'm just happy that Arya will be in this book too. :)
Am I impatiently waiting for the next book? Yes... Do I want or expect crap? No. Do I appriciate the updates so I have some concept of what is going on OH YEAH!!!
I'm glad to hear Sansa's in this one (if that chapter is for Dance)!  Looking forward to her and Arya.  Best of luck!

I just want to say your writing style is the most amazing I have ever read. I read lots of different genres but your books transport me (utterly and totally) to a different world. I have been waiting patiently for Dance for over a year now, yet the world you created is still crisp in my mind....

It seems finishing off Dance is an uphill climb with a deadline looming. With the completion of book 7, I really do hope you continue to write other (similar) stories......that is, after your year-long world trip! :)
comments.subject: Keep pluggin

comments.article: Oh! I am so excited for this tale. <3 Sansa!!
Keep on keeping on, sir.  Just gives me time to reread it all over again. =D But don't be lonely, we're all thinking of you!
